author: Stephen Fidler
title: U.K.’s Post-Brexit Future Hinges on the U.S.
text:
Two important developments over the last couple of weeks have crystallized how the world has moved on since the 2016 British referendum vote to leave the European Union.
President Donald Trump’s decision to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum—using a rarely-invoked national security clause—threatens to undermine the World Trade Organization, the body the U.K. has depicted as the pillar of global free trade and on which its future growth prospects hang.
